--- title: "Themes, Annotations and Interactivity" date: today date-format: long footer: "[DataViz 2102 Website](https://dataviz-gwu.rocks)" logo: images/dataviz-logo.png format: revealjs: theme: [simple, custom.scss] transition: fade slide-number: true multiplex: true chalkboard: true execute: echo: false message: false warning: false freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ## Column Chart from Last Class ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/column_chart1-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Add a Theme ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/column_chart2-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Can Also Set Theme {.smaller}
If you like particular theme and want to use it for all of your visualizations, use `theme_set()` in a code chunk at the top of your document, e.g....
::: {.cell} ````{.cell-code} ```{{r}} #| label: my_setup_chunk theme_set(theme_minimal()) ``` ```` :::
... and R will apply that theme to all of the visualizations in your document. ## Your Turn! Produce this scatter plot... Then try different [themes](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/ggtheme.html). ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/exercise1-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
10:00
``` ::: ::: ## Your Turn! ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wealth_flfp <- ggplot(flfp_gdp, aes(x = gdp_pc, y = flfp)) + geom_point(aes(color = region)) + geom_smooth(method = "loess", linewidth = 1) + scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_dollar()) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1)) + labs( x= "GDP per Capita", y = "Female Labor Force Participation", title = "Wealth and female labor force participation", caption = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", color = "Region" ) + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma", end = .7) wealth_flfp + theme_dark() ``` ::: ## Add an Annotation ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/annotation1-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## First step, add a horizontal line using `geom_hline()`... ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line + geom_hline(yintercept = 52, linetype="dashed", color = "red", size = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Second step, the annotation with `annotate()`... ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line + geom_hline(yintercept = 52, linetype="dashed", color = "red", size = 1) + annotate("text", x = 1995, y = 55, label = "Global average") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Vertical Reference Line ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## First step, add a horizontal line using `geom_hline()`... ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line + geom_vline(xintercept=2020, linetype = "dashed", size = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Second step, add the annotation with `annotate()` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line + geom_vline(xintercept=2020, linetype = "dashed", size = 1) + annotate("text", x = 2017, y = 35, label = "Pandemic") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](week-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Your Turn! - Go to module 2.2 - Copy the code you need to make the line chart - Create a horizontal reference line and annotate it - In a new code chunk, create a vertical line and annotate it - Play with the parameters to move and style your line - Try different text, etc. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
10:00
``` ::: ::: ## Interactivity ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## The Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(plotly) wealth_flfp_plotly <- wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() + aes(label = country) # need so ggplot retains label for plotly ggplotly(wealth_flfp_plotly, tooltip = c("country", "flfp", "gdp_pc")) |> # add source layout(annotations = list(text = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", font = list(size = 10), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = 1.1, xanchor = 'right', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = -.1, yanchor = 'auto', yshift = 0)) |> # add web address layout(annotations = list(text = "www.dataviz-gwu.rocks", font = list(size = 10, color = 'grey'), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = .5, xanchor = 'center', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = 1, yanchor = 'top', yshift = 0)) ``` ::: ## The Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="1"} library(plotly) wealth_flfp_plotly <- wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() + aes(label = country) # need so ggplot retains label for plotly ggplotly(wealth_flfp_plotly, tooltip = c("country", "flfp", "gdp_pc")) |> # add source layout(annotations = list(text = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", font = list(size = 10), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = 1.1, xanchor = 'right', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = -.1, yanchor = 'auto', yshift = 0)) |> # add web address layout(annotations = list(text = "www.dataviz-gwu.rocks", font = list(size = 10, color = 'grey'), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = .5, xanchor = 'center', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = 1, yanchor = 'top', yshift = 0)) ``` ::: ## The Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="6"} library(plotly) wealth_flfp_plotly <- wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() + aes(label = country) # need so ggplot retains label for plotly ggplotly(wealth_flfp_plotly, tooltip = c("country", "flfp", "gdp_pc")) |> # add source layout(annotations = list(text = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", font = list(size = 10), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = 1.1, xanchor = 'right', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = -.1, yanchor = 'auto', yshift = 0)) |> # add web address layout(annotations = list(text = "www.dataviz-gwu.rocks", font = list(size = 10, color = 'grey'), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = .5, xanchor = 'center', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = 1, yanchor = 'top', yshift = 0)) ``` ::: ## The Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="8"} library(plotly) wealth_flfp_plotly <- wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() + aes(label = country) # need so ggplot retains label for plotly ggplotly(wealth_flfp_plotly, tooltip = c("country", "flfp", "gdp_pc")) |> # add source layout(annotations = list(text = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", font = list(size = 10), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = 1.1, xanchor = 'right', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = -.1, yanchor = 'auto', yshift = 0)) |> # add web address layout(annotations = list(text = "www.dataviz-gwu.rocks", font = list(size = 10, color = 'grey'), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = .5, xanchor = 'center', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = 1, yanchor = 'top', yshift = 0)) ``` ::: ## The Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="10-14"} library(plotly) wealth_flfp_plotly <- wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() + aes(label = country) # need so ggplot retains label for plotly ggplotly(wealth_flfp_plotly, tooltip = c("country", "flfp", "gdp_pc")) |> # add source layout(annotations = list(text = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", font = list(size = 10), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = 1.1, xanchor = 'right', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = -.1, yanchor = 'auto', yshift = 0)) |> # add web address layout(annotations = list(text = "www.dataviz-gwu.rocks", font = list(size = 10, color = 'grey'), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = .5, xanchor = 'center', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = 1, yanchor = 'top', yshift = 0)) ``` ::: ## The Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="15-19"} library(plotly) wealth_flfp_plotly <- wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() + aes(label = country) # need so ggplot retains label for plotly ggplotly(wealth_flfp_plotly, tooltip = c("country", "flfp", "gdp_pc")) |> # add source layout(annotations = list(text = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", font = list(size = 10), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = 1.1, xanchor = 'right', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = -.1, yanchor = 'auto', yshift = 0)) |> # add web address layout(annotations = list(text = "www.dataviz-gwu.rocks", font = list(size = 10, color = 'grey'), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = .5, xanchor = 'center', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = 1, yanchor = 'top', yshift = 0)) ``` ::: ## But to make a plotly chart, all you need is this! ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplotly(wealth_flfp_plotly) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
## Your Turn! - Go to module 2.2 and create the basic wealth vs. flfp scatter plot - Now "plotlify" the plot - At first, don't worry about annotations or tool tip - Then add in tool tip, play with setting - Then add in the annotations - Move annotations, change content ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
10:00
``` ::: ::: ## Time Permitting Annotate (comment) the following code... ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wealth_flfp <- ggplot(flfp_gdp, aes(x = gdp_pc, y = flfp)) + geom_point(aes(color = region)) + geom_smooth(method = "loess", linewidth = 1) + scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_dollar()) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1)) + labs( x= "GDP per Capita", y = "Female Labor Force Participation", title = "Wealth and female labor force participation", caption = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", color = "Region" ) + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma", end = .7) wealth_flfp + theme_minimal() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
05:00
``` ::: ::: ## Time permitting Annotate (comment) the following code... ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line <- ggplot(flfp_ts, aes(x = year, y = flfp, color = region)) + geom_line(linewidth = 1) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1)) + labs( x = "Year", y = "Female Labor Force Participation", title = "Regional trends in female labor force participation", caption = "Source: V-Dem Institute", color = "Country" ) + scale_color_viridis_d() + theme_minimal() flfp_line + geom_hline(yintercept = 52, linetype="dashed", color = "red", size = 1) + annotate("text", x = 1995, y = 55, label = "Global average") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
05:00
``` ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
